intents.tag: replacement of a joist with a wooden post
patterns: replacing a joist with a wooden post
replace a joist with a wooden post
What are the steps for replacing a joist with a wooden post?
How do I replace a joist with a wooden post?
What are the advantages of replacing a joist with a wooden post?
What factors need to be taken into account when replacing a joist with a timber column?
Are there any specific restrictions or regulations for replacing a joist with a wooden post?
What are the differences between a wooden joist and a wooden column in terms of performance and functionality?
Are there any special precautions to be taken when replacing a joist with a timber column?
What materials and tools are needed to replace a joist with a timber column?
What are the selection criteria for choosing a suitable wooden post to replace a joist?
Are there any alternatives to replacing a joist with a timber column?

responses.text:
To replace a joist with a wooden post, follow these steps: 
1) Check that the required individual and collective safety equipment is complete and in good condition
2) Collect the consignment certificate from the shunter
3) Systematically brief the team on the site
4) Check that the section of line to be consigned is de-energized (VAT)
5) Install the earthing system grounding (MALT) and short-circuiting on HV and LV structures within the perimeter of the work area
6) Install regulatory markers and signs to secure the work area
7) Carry out the excavation at the location defined in the Work Order
a) Ensure that the excavation depth is respected (H/10 + 0, 5) and cut a slot to guide the support. b) Drill holes in the support to secure the armament. c) Use one of the following two methods to bury the support: 
- Manual method (with 2 short and 2 long forks)
- Place 2 crowbars in the excavation to wedge the base of the support
- Position the base of the support on the edge of the excavation
- Lift the support using 4 forks positioned along the length of the support
- Orient the support using 3 service ropes attached 2m from the top and positioned at 120° to each other. 
- Lifting truck crane method
- Tie the tie 1/3 of the way from the top
- Position the crane truck close to the excavation
- Lift the pole using the crane truck
- Position the base of the support inside the excavation
- Orient the support using the crane truck, tongs, lead bars9) Wedge the support (1st wedge at 20 cm and 2nd wedge at 50 cm) with 'Rufisque' or basalt stones, add fine sand as you go, then backfill and tamp down10) Fit the reinforcement at the head of the wooden post and secure with bolts11) Fit the insulators12) Transfer the conductors to the wooden post using 2 pulleys positioned on the 2 lateral phases13. Raise the truss and remove the armament14. Hold the truss in place with a tie using lifting gear15. Break off the mass and cut off the bottom of the girder using a flashlight (take care to cut the girder 20cm below ground level).16. Using service ropes, gently lower the truss to the ground17. Remove earthing and stow away beacons18. Clean up the site19. Put away equipment and tools20. Assemble team and debrief21. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment manager. 22. Notify the Central (or Regional) Control Office when work has been completed Means of execution 
Ø Safety equipment 
- Safety harnesses + accessories (climbers, etc.) 
- Work gloves 
- Work clothing 
- VAT 
- Safety helmet 
- Safety shoes 
- First aid kit 
- Beacon : Safety sign, banner, traffic signs, cones 
- Fluorescent vest 
- 02 Earthing and short-circuiting 
- 02 Service ropes 
Ø Tools and consumables 
- 01 12m wooden pole 
- 01 complete armament 
- 03 rigid insulators or 03 composite insulators or 03 complete insulator chains (depending on line configuration, rigid or suspended) 
- 03 reinforced rods + accessories
- 04 forks
- 03 handling ropes
- 01 complete toolbox
- 01 blowtorch
- Ties or slings
- 03 bare wire ties
- Complete MALT for pole 01 compacting tamper 02 decoiling pulleys 02 crowbars 20 wedge stones Rolling stock 01 truck crane 01 aerial work platform 02 4X4 double-cab vehicles with ladder rack ladder- 01 cart to transport the supportWorkforce- 01 works manager- 05 workers- 02 machine drivers- 02 trawlers (service providers)
Timetable- 02 hours: For marshy or flood-prone areas and soft ground, a metal shaft is required to be installed in the excavation after point 7. 
At point 9, provide marine cement and sand to fill the metal barrel and wait 30min
responses.page: it can be found on pages 17 to 19 of the guide

intents.tag: replacement of a wooden post with a concrete post
patterns: replacing a wood post with a concrete post
how to replace a wood post with a concrete post
What are the steps for replacing a wooden post with a concrete post?
How to replace a wooden post with a concrete post
What are the advantages of replacing a wooden post with a concrete one?
What are the factors to consider when replacing a wooden post with a concrete one?
Are there any specific restrictions or regulations for replacing a wooden post with a concrete one?
What are the differences between a wooden post and a concrete post in terms of performance and functionality?
Are there any special precautions to be taken when replacing a wooden post with a concrete one?
What materials and tools are needed to replace a wooden post with a concrete one?
What are the selection criteria for choosing a suitable concrete post to replace a wooden post?
Are there any alternatives to replacing a wooden post with a concrete post?

responses.text:
To replace a wooden post with a concrete post, follow these steps:
Operation
1. Using a template depending on the force of the support, perform core drilling 3 days before the work at the place indicated in the established Work Order. If the ground is hard, coring is not necessary
2. On the D-day, Check whether the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition
3.Collect the lockout certificate from the shunting agent8
4. Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team
5. Check that the section of line to be locked out is switched off (VAT) 
6. Put the Grounding (MALT) and short - circuit on the MV and LV works that are in the work area
7. Put the regulatory beacons and signs to secure the work area
8. Lift and stake the concrete post using a crane truck
9 Attach the tie 1/3 of the length from the top
10. Position the crane truck near the excavation
11. Raise the pole using the crane truck
12. Position the base of the support inside the trench
13. Orient the support using the truck crane, pliers, crowbars
14. Properly position the support in alignment
15. Fill with the mixture (cement, concrete, sand…) until the diamond point is
formed
16. Set up the armament at the head of the concrete post and fix it with bolts approximately 1h30min after filling to allow drying
17. Set up the insulators
18. Transfer the conductors to the wooden post using 2 unwinding pulleys positioned on the 2 side phases
19. Climb the wooden post, drop the weaponry
20. Hold the wooden post with a tie using a lifting device
21. Request a digger to remove the 1st and 2nd stage wedging stones
22. Using ties, tear off the support and place it gently on the ground
23. Proceed with the final connection of the concrete post after adjusting the deflections
24. Remove grounding and stow beacons
25. Properly clean the construction site
26. Store materials and tools
27. Gather the whole team and debrief
28. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer
29. Notify the Central (or Regional) Control Office of the end of the work
Means of execution
Ø	Safety equipment
•	 Safety harness + accessories (climbs, ropes, etc.)
•	 Work gloves 
•	 Helmet
•	 Safety shoes
•	 Work clothes
•	 Fluorescent vest
•	 Beacon: safety sign, banner, traffic signs, cones
• 	 First aid kit
•	 VAT
•	 02 Grounding and short-circuiting
Ø	 Tools and consumables
•	 01 concrete post 12m
•	 Cement , sand, concrete, water
•	 01 complete armament
•	 03 rigid insulators or 03 composite insulators or 03 complete chains of insulators
(depending on the configuration of the line, rigid or suspended)
 •	 03 reinforced rods + accessories
•	 01 complete tool box
•	 03 bare wire ties
•	 Complete MALT for the pole
•	 02 ties or slings
• 	 Ladder
Ø	Rolling stock
•	 01 nacelle
•	 01 crane for lifting and transporting the support
•	 01 double cabin 4X4 vehicle equipped with ladder rack
Ø	 Main work:
•	 01 works manager
•	 05 workers
•	 02 machine operators
Performance time
•	 05 hours
NB: For marshy or flood-prone areas , it will be necessary to provide marine cement
responses.page: it is on page 20 and 21 of the guide

responses.text:
To replace a wooden post with a tubular metal post, here are the steps to follow:
Procedure
1. Check that the required individual and collective safety equipment is complete and in good condition
2. Retrieve the certificate with the shunting agent4
3. Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team
4. Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is switched off
5. Install the Earthing ( MALT) and short-circuited on the MV and LV structures which are
in the work area8
6. Install regulatory beacons and signs to secure the work area
7. Carry out the search according to the location defined in Work Order
8. Lift and stake the 12m metal pole using a crane truck
9. Attach the tie 1/3 of the length from the top
10. Position the crane truck nearby of the excavation
11. Raise the post using the crane truck
12. Position the base of the support inside the excavation
13. Orient the support using the truck crane, pliers, crowbars
14. Orient the support of the machine, then wedge (1st 1st at 20 cm and 2nd wedge at 50 cm) with stones
of Rufisque or basalt, add fine sand as you go then backfill and ram.
15. Set up the armament at the head of the conical metal pole and fix it with
bolts
16. Set up the insulators
17. Transfer the conductors to the tapered metal post
18. Climb the wooden post, drop the conductors and the armament
19. Hold the wooden post with a tie using a lifting device
20. Request a digger to remove 1st and 2nd stage wedging stones
21. Using ropes, gently place the wooden post on the ground
22. Remove grounding and stow beacons
23. Properly clean the construction site
24. Store materials and tools
25. Gather the whole team and debrief
26. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer
27. Notify the Central (or Regional) Control Office of the end of the work
Means of execution
Ø	Safety equipment
•	 Safety harness + accessories (climbs, service rope, etc.)
•	 Gloves 
•	 Work clothes
•	 Helmet
•	 Safety shoes
•	 Fluorescent vest
•	 Beacon: safety sign, banner, cones, traffic signs n•	 First aid kit
•	 VAT
•	 02 Grounding and short-circuiting
•	 01 compaction ram
Ø	 Tools and consumables
• t 01 tubular metal pole 12m
•	 01 complete arming
•	 03 rigid insulators or 03 composite insulators or 03 complete chains of insulators (depending on the configuration of the line, rigid or suspended)
• t 03 reinforced rods + accessories
•	 03 handling ropes
•	 01 complete tool box
•	 3 bare wire ties
•	 Complete MALT for the post
•	 20 Rufisque or Basalt stones
Ø	Rolling equipment
•	 01 lifting machine
•	 01 double cabin 4X4 vehicle equipped with ladder rack
•	 01 trolley to transport the support
Ø t Labour
•	 01 works manager
•	 04 workers
•	 01 machine operator
Performance time

responses.text:
The repair of a cut MV conductor works as such: 
Operating mode 
2 Check whether the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition 3
 Retrieve the consignment certificate from the operator 4
 Systematically brief the team on the site 
5 Identify the damaged part 6
 Check that the section of line to be consigned (VAT) is switched off 
7 Install the Earthing ( MALT) and short-circuited on the MV and LV structures that are in the work area 8
 Install regulatory beacons and road signs to secure the work area 
9 Lower the conductor of the section to be replaced 
10 Cut all the defective part of the conductor 
10. Position the 1st sleeve on the end of the conductor and crimp 
11. Take a length of conductor equal to that cut and crimp on one end 
12. Using 2 frogs, a hoist or pull lift, pull the 2 conductors 
13. Position the 2nd sleeve on the 2nd end and crimp 
14. Drop frogs, hoist, pull lift N15. Replace the conductor on the clamp or insulator 
16. Remove grounding and stow beacons
17. Properly clean the construction site N18. Store equipment and tools 
19. Gather the whole team and debrief 
20. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer 
21. Notify the Central (or Regional) Control Office of the end of the work 
Means of execution

•	 Safety harness + accessories (climbs, etc.) 
•	 Work gloves 
 •	 Helmet

•	 Work clothes 
•	 Wood and iron climbers 
•	 Beacon: banners, safety signs, traffic signs, cones

•	 Earthing and short-circuiting

•	 02 junction sleeves or 02 straight connectors. 
•	 01 hoist or pull lift 
•	 02 frogs 
•	 01 complete toolbox 
•	 01 crimper 
•	 01 ladder 
•	 01 service rope 
•	 01 handling rope

•	 03 fitters

responses.text:
For HTA driver renewal, please follow these steps:
Operating procedure 
2 Check that the required individual and collective safety equipment is complete and in good condition 
3 Obtain the consignment certificate from the agent 
4 Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team 5
 Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is de-energized 
6 Install the Earthing (MALT) and short circuit on the MV and LV structures that are in the work area 
7 Install regulatory beacons and signs to secure the work area 8
 Position the reel on jacks or an unwinding machine at the start of the section to be 
renewed 10 n Raise all the supports concerned and undo the bindings 11
 Place the conductor to be removed on a systematic pulley 
10. Guy the two end supports of the section in question 
11 using strong pulls. using tirvits or pull lift N12. Remove clamps 
13. Thread the old cable and the new cable on the reel side using two socks and a swivel 
14. At the other end of the section to be renewed, unhook the conductor to be replaced using a tirvit if necessary 
15. Tie the rope to the end of the sock on the conductor, 
16. Pass the rope through the pulley 
17. Remove the tirvit or pull lift 
18. Pull gently using a winch 
19. When the new cable reaches the other end support, stop the pull and anchor the 
20 line. Adjust the line according to the deflection/tension on the anchor support 
reel side then anchor the line 
21. Position the new cable on the alignment clamps or on the grooves of the insulators 
22. Remove the pulleys 
23. Repeat the same operations (step 9 to 22) on the 2 other phases 
24. Remove the temporary stays 
25. Rewind the cable deposited and load on a vehicle 
26. Remove the ground connections and store the beacons 
27. Properly clean the construction site N28. Store equipment and tools
29. Gather the whole team and debrief 
30. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer
31. Communicate to the Central (or Regional) Control Office the end of the work 
Means of execution 
Ø	Safety equipment 
•	 Safety harness + accessories 
•	 Work gloves 
•	 VAT  n•	 Helmet 
•	 Safety shoes 
•	 First aid kit 
•	 Work clothes 
•	 Fluorescent vest 
•	 Wooden and iron climbers 
• t Beacon: banner, safety sign, road sign, cones 
•	 Grounding and short-circuiting 
Ø	Tools and consumables 
•	 Cable reel required for renewal 
• t 02 pullers 
•	 02 tirvits 
•	 Unwinding pulleys 
•	 03 socks 
•	 02 swivels 
•	 01 unwinder 
•	 Fasteners 
• t Lifting and service rope 
•	 Ladder 
•	 01 Pull lift

 Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is switched off

 Remove the ligatures from the lines

 Remove the insulators

Procedure

12. Fit the mounting uprights if there are This is an arch cover (to be fixed with bolts or clamps) 
13 Pass the cable inside the uprights 
14. Fix the crosspiece 
15. Position the caliper and the ball joint on the 3 conductors 
16. Mount the insulators and hook them to the bracket 
17. Attach the ball-socket to the hanging insulator 
18. Hook the alignment clamp onto the ball-socket 
19. Hook the line onto the alignment clamp 
20. Remove the ground connections and store the beacons

responses.text:
Please follow the steps below to replace a rigid insulator:
Procedure 
1. Check that the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition 
2. Retrieve the certificate of consignment to the shunting agent 
3. Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team

5. Install the Earthing (MALT ) and in short - circuit on the MV and LV works which are in the work area 
6. Mark the work area 
7. Remove the ligatures from the lines and unscrew the insulator 
8. Put the conductor on the arming to release the insulator 
9. Unscrew and remove the defective insulator 
10. Raise the new insulator, already cleaned, using the service rope 
11. Fix the insulator on the reinforced rod 
12. Put the conductor in the groove of the insulator 
13. Lay and secure the ligatures 
14. Remove the earthings and store the beacons 
15. Properly clean the construction site N16. Store equipment and tools 
17. Bring the whole team together and debrief 
18. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer

responses.text:
According to the guide it's not really a question but rather steps to follow here are the ones I have in my database: 
Ground connections are installed on all types of supports, namely 
wooden posts (connected to armaments), tubular metal supports and 
concrete supports (in the presence of IACM) and beams.
Mode of operation 
1. Check whether the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition 
2. Systematically brief the team on the site 
3. Mark out the work area 
4. Measure the earth resistance values 
5. Check that there are no no break on the equipotential bond 
6. Reconnect the bond if there is a break 
7. Improve the value to 10 ohms if it is not compliant by placing another earth rod 
in parallel about 7 away meters and/or by substituting the ground with 
products or earths that have good resistivity 
8. Store tags 
9. Properly clean the construction site N10. Store equipment and tools 
11. Gather the whole team and debrief 
Means of execution

patterns: How to replace a wooden post with a tubular metal post?
What are the steps to replace a wooden post with a metal post?
What are the procedures for replacing a wooden post with a tubular metal post?
How should we proceed to replace a wooden post with a tubular metal post?
What are the key steps to follow when replacing a wooden post with a tubular metal post?
How can you effectively replace a wooden post with a tubular metal post?
What are the recommendations for replacing a wooden post with a tubular metal post in an adequate manner?

responses.text:
Replacing a wooden post with a tubular metal post is done by following the following steps:
1. Check that the required individual and collective safety equipment is complete and in good condition.
2. Collect the certificate of lockout from the shunting agent.
3. Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team.
4. Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is switched off.
5. Install the Earthing (MALT) and short-circuiting on the MV and LV works that are in the work area.
6. Install the regulatory markers and signs to secure the work area.
7. Carry out the search according to the location defined in the Work Order.
8. Lift and install the 12m metal pole using a crane truck.
9. Tie the tie at 1/3 of the length from the top. 
10. Position the crane truck near the excavation.
11. Raise the post using the crane truck.
12. Position the base of the support inside the excavation.
13. Orient the support using the truck crane, pliers, crowbars.
14. Orient the machine support, then wedge (1st at 20 cm and 2nd wedge at 50 cm) with Rufisque or basalt stones, add fine sand as you go, then backfill and ram.
15. Set up the armament at the head of the conical metal pole and fixing with bolts.
16. Set up the insulators.
17. Transfer the conductors to the tapered metal post.
18. Climb the wooden post, drop the conductors and the armament.
19. Hold the wooden post with a tie using a lifting device.
20. Request a digger to remove 1st and 2nd stage wedging stones.
21. Using ropes, gently place the wooden post on the ground.
22. Remove grounding and stow beacons.
23. Properly clean the construction site.
24. Store equipment and tools.
25. Gather the whole team and debrief.
26. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer.
27. Notify the Central (or Regional) Control Office of the end of the work.

For more details, please refer to pages 22 and 23 of the Sénélec maintenance guide.
responses.page: it is on page 22 and 23 of the senelec maintenance guide

The individual and collective safety equipment required for the replacement of a wooden post by a tubular metal post includes:
- Safety harness + accessories (climbs, service rope, ...)
- Work gloves

- Helmet
- Safety shoes
- Fluorescent vest
- Beacons: safety sign, banner, cones, road signs
- First aid kit
- VAT (Verification of Absence of Voltage)
- Grounding and short-circuiting
- Compaction valve

What are the recommended steps to carry out the excavation when replacing a wooden post with a metal post?
How should one go about carrying out the excavation when replacing a wooden post with a metal post?

responses.text:
To perform the excavation when replacing a wooden post with a tubular metal post, follow these steps:
1. Perform the excavation at the location defined in the Work Order.
2. Survey and stake out the 12m metal post using a crane truck.
3. Attach the tie 1/3 of the length from the top.
4. Position the crane truck near the excavation.
5. Lift the post using the truck crane.
6. Position the base of the support inside the excavation.
7. Orient the support using the truck crane, clamps, crowbars.
8. Orient the machine support, then wedge (1st at 20 cm and 2nd wedge at 50 cm) with Rufisque or basalt stones, add fine sand as you go, then backfill and tamp.

For more details, please refer to pages 22 and 23 of the Senelec maintenance guide.
responses.page: it is on page 22 and 23 of the senelec maintenance guide

intents.tag: Repair of a cut MV conductor
patterns: What are the steps to repair a cut HTA conductor?
How to proceed with the repair of a cut HTA conductor?
What are the procedures to follow to repair a cut HTA conductor?
How should one proceed to repair a cut MV conductor?
What are the key steps to follow for the repair of a cut HTA conductor?
How can a cut MV conductor be effectively repaired?
What are the recommendations for carrying out the repair of a cut MV conductor in an adequate manner?

responses.text: To repair a cut MV conductor, here are the steps to follow: 1. Check the individual and collective safety equipment required. 2. Collect the lockout certificate from the shunting agent. 3. Make a briefing on the site with the team 4. Identify the damaged part 5. Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is de-energized 6. Install the Earthing (MALT) and short-circuit the MV and LV structures in the work area. 7. Install the regulatory beacons and signs to secure the work area. 8. Lower the conductor of the section to be replaced. 9. Cut off all the defective part of the conductor. 10. Position the 1st sleeve on the end of the conductor and crimp. 11. Take a length of conductor equivalent to that cut and crimp on one end. 12. Use frogs, a hoist or pull lift to pull the 2 13. Position the 2nd sleeve on the 2nd end and perform the crimp. 14. Remove the frogs, the hoist and the pull lift. 15. Replace the conductor on the clamp or insulator. 16. Remove grounds and store beacons. 17. Thoroughly clean the site. 18. Store materials and tools. 19. Bring the whole team together and debrief. 20. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer. 21. Inform the Central (or Regional) Control Office of the end of the work.
responses.page: it is on page 23 and 23 of the senelec maintenance guide

Could you describe the steps required to perform the replacement of a rigid armament?

responses.text: To replace a rigid weapon, here are the steps to follow: 1. Check that the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition. 2. Obtain the consignment certificate from the 3. Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team 4. Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is switched off 5. Install the Earthing (MALT) and short-circuit the MV and LV structures that are in the work area. 6. Install regulatory beacons and signs to secure the work area. 7. Remove the ligatures from the lines. 8. Secure the line to the support. 9. Remove the insulators 10. Remove the defective armament by removing the fixings and slide it towards the ground with a service rope 11. Bring up the new armament which must be fixed on the post with a bolt and a lag screw. 12. Position the insulators then fix the line with the ligatures 13. Resume the fixing of the earth cable. 14. Remove the grounds and store the beacons. 15. Properly clean the site. 16. Store materials and tools. 17. Bring the whole team together and debrief. 18. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer. 19. Communicate to the Central (or Regional) Control Office the end of the work.
responses.page: it is on page 28 and 27 of the senelec maintenance guide

patterns: What are the steps for replacing a suspended armament?

I would like to understand the exact procedure for replacing a suspended armament, can you enlighten me?

responses.text: The replacement of a suspended armament is done by following the following steps: check the safety equipment, retrieve the lockout certificate, brief the team, de-energize the section of line, place the grounding, set up the signaling beacons, climb on the nacelle, unhook the line, remove the insulators, unscrew the bolts securing the armament, remove the defective armament, put the armament uprights , pass the cable inside the uprights, fix the crosspiece, position the bracket and the ball joint, mount the insulators, hook the ball-socket, hook the alignment clamp, hook the line on the alignment clamp , remove the grounding, clean the site, put away the equipment and do a debriefing.
responses.page: it is on page 29 and 30 of the senelec maintenance guide

patterns: What are the steps for replacing a rigid insulator?
How to replace a rigid insulator?
What is the procedure for replacing a rigid insulator?
What actions should be taken when replacing a rigid insulator?

responses.text: Here are the steps for replacing a rigid insulator: check that the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition, collect the lockout certificate from the shunting agent, make a briefing on the site with the team, check the de-energization of the section of line to be consigned (VAT), install the Earthing (MALT) and short-circuit on the MV and LV works which are in the zone of work, mark out the work area, remove the ligatures from the lines and unscrew the insulator, put the conductor on the arming to release the insulator, unscrew and remove the defective insulator, mount the new insulator already cleaned with the using the service rope, fix the insulator on the reinforced rod, put the conductor in the throat of the insulator, install and fix the ligatures, remove the earthings and store the beacons, clean the site properly, tidy up equipment and tools, gather the whole team and do a debriefing, return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer, communicate to the Central (or Regional) Control Office the end of the work.

patterns: What are the steps for replacing a hanging insulator?
What is the procedure for replacing a suspended insulator?
How to replace a suspended insulator?
What are the execution means to replace a hanging insulator?

responses.text:
Replacing a suspended insulator involves the following steps:
1. Check that the required individual and collective safety equipment is complete and in good condition.
2. Obtain the lockout certificate from the shunting agent.
3. Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team.
4. Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is switched off.
5. Install the Earthing (MALT) and short-circuited on the MV and LV structures that are in the work area.
6. Install regulatory markers and signs to secure the work area.
7. Unhook the line and put it on a pulley.
8 . Unhook the insulator chain and lower it using the service rope.
9. Attach the composite insulator, raise it then hook it onto the stirrup.
10. Pull the cable to bring it closer the insulator anchor clamp.
11. Attach the chain to the ball-socket.
12. Remove the groundings and store the beacons.
13. Properly clean the construction site.
14. Store materials and tools.
15. Gather the whole team and debrief.
16. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment manager.
17. Communicate to the Central (or Regional) Control Office the end of the work.
responses.page: it is on page 31 and 32 of the senelec maintenance guide

patterns: What are the steps for replacing line equipment?

responses.text: The steps for replacing chain equipment are as follows: 1. Check that the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition. 2. Obtain the lockout certificate from the agent 3. Systematically brief the team on the site 4. Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is de-energized 5. Install the Grounding (MALT) and short-circuit on the MV and LV structures that are in the work area. 6. Install regulatory beacons and signs to secure the work area. 7. Position the tie on the equipment. 8. Release the line. 9. Remove the chain by removing the stirrup 10. Attach the ball-socket and the stirrup to the cocking 11. Hook the isolator onto the swivel eyelet 12. Hook the ball-socket onto the isolator. 13. Hook the conductor onto the alignment clamp 14. Remove the groundings and store the beacons 15. Properly clean the site. 16. Store materials and tools. 17. Bring the whole team together and debrief. 18. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment officer. 19. Communicate to the Central (or Regional) Control Office the end of the work.

patterns: How to replace the IACM?
What are the steps for replacing the IACM?
What is the procedure for replacing the IACM?
How do I replace the IACM?

responses.text:
The replacement of the IACM is done by following the following steps: 

1. Check that the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition.
2. Retrieve the consignment certificate with the switching agent.
3. Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team.
4. Check that the section of line to be locked out (VAT) is switched off.
5. Install the Earthing (MALT) and short-circuited on the MV and LV structures that are in the work area.
6. Install regulatory markers and signs to secure the work area.
7. Disconnect the bridges.
8. Disconnect the control and remove it.
9. Using the crane, hold the IACM firmly.
10. Unscrew the frame.
11. Remove the IACM.
12. Using the crane, position and bolt the IACM to the bracket.
13. Attach the control linkage to the moving part of the IACM.
14. Attach the linkage guide to the bracket.
15. Attach the control lever to the the linkage and then onto the support.
16. Make the adjustment of the IACM to have a good opening and closing.
17. Reconnect the bridges.
18. Remove grounding and stow beacons.
19. Properly clean the construction site.
20. Store materials and tools.
21. Gather the whole team and debrief.
22. Return the consignment certificate to the consignment manager.
23. Communicate to the Central (or Regional) Control Office the end of the work.
responses.page: it is on page 34 and 35 of the senelec maintenance guide

patterns: How to perform Air fault detector relay maintenance of an air fault detector relay?
What are the Air Fault Detector Relay Maintenance Steps for an Air Fault Detector Relay?
What are the means of execution necessary for Maintenance air fault detector relay of an air fault detector relay?
How long does it take to perform Air Fault Detector Relay Maintenance on an Air Fault Detector Relay?

responses.text:
Air fault detector relay maintenance of an air fault detector relay takes place according to the following steps:
1. Verification of the individual and collective safety equipment required.
2. Retrieval of the lockout certificate. n3. Briefing on the site with the team.
4. Checking that the section of line to be locked out has been de-energized.
5. Earthing and short-circuiting on the MV and LV structures in the work area. 
6. Marking the work area.
7. Removing the relay by climbing on the support.
8. Checking that the relay is working properly.
9. Periodic replacement or if necessary of the battery.
10. Replacement of the relay on the line according to the instructions in the manual.
11. Removal of earthing and storage of beacons.
12. Cleaning of the site.
13. Storage of equipment and tools.
14. Debriefing with the team.
15. Return of the consignment certificate.
16. Communication of the end of the work to the Central (or Regional) Control Office.
responses.page: It is on page 36 and 37 of the Senelec maintenance guide.

patterns: How to improve grounding of the masses?
What are the procedures for improving grounding?
What are the means of execution to improve a grounding?
What are the measures to be taken to improve the earth resistance?
What are the recommended methods for improving grounding of masses?
What are the procedures to follow to improve an existing grounding?
Can you give me information on the means of execution to improve a grounding?
What measures can be taken to strengthen the grounding resistance and improve the grounding of the masses?
How can the performance of grounding be improved by taking specific measures?

responses.text:
To improve grounding, here are the steps to follow:
1. Check that the individual and collective safety equipment required is complete and in good condition.
2. Systematically give a briefing on the site with the team.
3. Mark out the work area.
4. Measure the earth resistance values.
5. Check that there is no break in the equipotential bonding.
6. Resume the connection if there is a break.
7. Improve the value to 10 ohms if it is not compliant by placing another earth rod in parallel about 7 meters away and/or by substituting the ground with products or soils that have good resistivity.
8. Put away beacons.
9. Properly clean the site.
10. Put away equipment and tools.
11. Gather the whole team and do a debriefing.

Transformers are widely used in electrical networks for the conversion of electrical energy.

What do we check during ground line inspections?
